poem:
### Headlines of Silence
  
In Madrid's hush,  
a life extinguished—  
bullet whispers  
through foreign streets.  
Echoes of power,  
distant lands merging,  
a heart's final beat  
in a city's quiet  
thrum.  
History entwines  
with today's news,  
a moment lost  
in the shuffle  
of autumn leaves.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Former Ukrainian presidential aide reportedly shot dead in Madrid – Europe live 1.01pm BST I will keep an eye for more updates out of Madrid, where a US-sanctioned ex-Ukrainian MP and senior aide to the country’s former pro-Russian president Viktor Yanukovych was shot dead, but in the meantime let me bring you some updates on other stories around Europe. 12.20pm BST Spanish daily El Mundo said, quoting its sources in Madrid police, that investigators looking". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
